meanings.definition: To cut something into thin, flat pieces.
meanings.sent1: She carefully sliced the apple for the pie.
meanings.sent2: The chef sliced the vegetables for the stir-fry.
meanings.sent3: He sliced the bread so thin, it looked like paper!
meanings.sent4: The sun sliced through the clouds, lighting up the sky.
meanings.sent5: The knife sliced effortlessly through the soft cheese.

meanings.definition: Having been cut into thin, flat pieces.
meanings.sent1: The sliced bread was perfect for sandwiches.
meanings.sent2: She served a plate of sliced cucumbers at the party.
meanings.sent3: The sliced cake disappeared quickly at the birthday celebration.
meanings.sent4: The sliced oranges glistened in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The sliced cheese added a delicious touch to the meal.
